items.title: FaceTime Photo Shoots
items.summary: While we are in the midst of the unfortunate Covid-19 outbreak, creativity has found its new ways. Introducing, FaceTime photo-shoots…
items.content_html:
While we are in the midst of the unfortunate Covid-19 outbreak, creativity has found its new ways.

Introducing, FaceTime photo-shoots where you can be anywhere in the world & we will work with you to create amazing photographs right from the comfort of your home!

Can anything be simpler than this?

PS: All these photos were shot on Facetime, 100% remotely!

items.title: Gaurav & Shilpi ‚Äì A Dehradun Lifestyle Shoot
items.summary: Lifestyle and couple shoots are my all time favourites for one, they give me full creative freedom as a photographer…
items.content_html:
Lifestyle and couple shoots are my all time favourites for one, they give me full creative freedom as a photographer and two, there are no super-tensed environments like a wedding. And no wonder, the ‚Äústory‚Äù part is the one that makes me work really hard for every single project.

When Shilpi emailed me to enquire about the possibility of documenting their love, I was super excited to know that they hail from Dehradun and I‚Äôd be shooting them there. So we decided on the dates and I packed my gear for the trip.

It was a 2-day schedule and I expected that everything was going to be smooth as butter. But as they say, ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt trust two things of Dehradun. The girls & the weather‚Äù. Now I‚Äôm not sure about the former, the latter did play games with us. The moment I landed in Dehradun (which was a night before), it started raining. And it rained all night and during the next day as well.

But like I always say, if we have planned something, we will do that no matter what. So I reached Shilpi‚Äôs home the next morning, half drenched. The conditions were not looking very positive but Shilpi & I were already finding ways to make it work. Gaurav however was convinced that the shoot wouldn‚Äôt happen and ultimately, we had to team up against him and pull him out of the house üòú

It was still raining and I was determined to make it an advantage for us. Why not let the rain add to the emotional quotient of the whole shoot? Keeping that thought and risking my camera, lenses and nose (which was red by the end of the shoot anyway), we together made these photographs üòá

The rain stopped (or rather paused) after sometime but it was still drizzling. That was the time to, as Shilpi & I put it, to bring up the ‚ÄúBhawna (emotion) meter‚Äù with Gaurav. Tough task, that was ü§£

Next morning, was a total flip in weather. It was bright, hot sunny all over and we were headed to Gaurav & Shilpi‚Äôs place for that day‚Äôs shoot. Before going with our plan, we decided to get some moments in their backyard garden

After that, our original plan was to head to Mussorie as there was snow-fall on the hill-tops the previous day. However, because of that, everyone was headed the same way and the whole route was jammed. So we decided to cancel that plan and settle for something nearby.

Did I tell you, this is that couple which looks better when fighting? Yes üòÑ

And that was Gaurav & Shilpi. That was Dehradun and that was a super tiring but amazing trip. Everything from the weather to the traffic conditions were against us but we turned everything to our advantage. I hope you felt the love from the photographs üòÑ

Contact Us

items.title: Love, Literally - Saumya & Arpan
items.summary: Saumya & Arpan both work in Cambridge and Oxford respectively. Some office co-incidences made them somehow fall in love and…
items.content_html:
Saumya & Arpan both work in Cambridge and Oxford respectively. Some office co-incidences made them somehow fall in love and I was called to put their love in photos. And then began the hunt for the perfect location. What could have been better than a library itself? With so many of our plans gone haywire, we finally managed to convince one librarian to let us shoot inside. And this is what followed

While Saumya was getting all excited on finding books and topics of her favourite writers, Arpan was discovering about their existence¬†

Bright sunlight and wind. It was perfect time for a Sunsilk ad photo üòú

And lastly, I played with some sunlight

Contact Us

items.title: The Royal Rajpoot Wedding - Aradhana & Divraj
items.summary: Coming back from the amazing pre-wedding mehendi day of Aradhana, this is the story of their wedding day which started…
items.content_html:
Coming back from the amazing pre-wedding mehendi day of Aradhana, this is the story of their wedding day which started somewhere around the afternoon. The decors from the last day were complete and the stage was being set up for their wedding as I arrived.

Everything had amazing details in their wedding. The setup you see below was made of bamboo sticks. Now, the length of the bamboo sticks wasn‚Äôt picked abruptly. It was a multiple of the length of Aradhana‚Äôs fore-arms. She told me they took the measure of her hands before setting it up. Talk about getting everything right¬†üôÇ

As the sun approached the horizon, it was time for the Safa-tying. Now the Safas of the two families were also different and for a reason. Aradhana‚Äôs family had the one with the long end, almost touching the ground. Divraj‚Äôs family on the other hand, had short ends which went till their mid-backs. Two Rajput families, two different traditions. This was another small detail.

Meanwhile, the bride herself was almost ready in the adjacent room!

Probably the youngest of the Thakurs I have ever come across¬†üòÄ

And of course, Divraj!

And then the bride arrived!

Stiff competition, I tell you¬†üòõ

And with that, both families thanked each other for everything. While I couldn‚Äôt do it that time, I‚Äôll say that right here: Thank You, Aradhana & Divraj for this wonderful opportunity to witness, attend and document your precious wedding. Every single moment I saw, every single person I met and every single experience I had was amazing. Thank you for being so detail oriented and taking the time to explain all those details to me. I wish I did justice to this amazing experience and I hope I did succeed in my efforts of putting everything I felt there, in these photographs¬†üôÇ

items.title: The Telugu - Punjabi Fusion Wedding
items.summary: Who says the group photos can't tell a story? The two photos here gets together people from extreme ends of…
items.content_html:
Who says the group photos can't tell a story? The two photos here gets together people from extreme ends of our country, coming together to celebrate love!

And there came Puneet!

All eyes and cameras up!

But look who's here too?

Oh, our very own Rahul in a new avatar!

Everybody welcomed Rahul with warn hugs and wishes

¬†

And it was time to start the ceremony

¬† ¬† ¬†

And that was the Anand Karaj ceremony. And Puneet was about to become a beautiful Telugu bride in the evening!

Puneet suprizing everyone with her saree charm!

And we had every ceremony's explanations going on as well so that all of us understood everything

With one special ritual in the Telugu wedding being that the groom goes on to leave the ceremony but the bride's brother convinces him and brings him back.

And one special ritual for Puneet wherein she was supposed to be carried in a basket to the mandap!

And with everything else said and done, it was time everyone has been waiting for!

When two best friends get married, fun is never out of the picture and we made sure the photos captured that essence!

The rice were even replaced by rose petals but Puneet & Rahul, just being themselves all the way :D

And with those smiles around and last few family pictures, we decided to call it a day! What a fun two days for me, capturing all the emotions, families, fun, culture and rituals.

items.title: Leh - Ladakh Pre Wedding Engagement Shoot
items.summary: Kashmir. The name is itself sufficient to give you that (not) warm-fuzzy feeling of just packing your bag and go.
items.content_html:
Kashmir. The name is itself sufficient to give you that (not) warm-fuzzy feeling of just packing your bag and go. So when Vidit & Aparna, two globe trotters themselves tossed me this idea of having their pre-wedding shoot in Ladakh, I was equally excited as I was scared. Excited because I knew there can be no better place in India to be for a shoot and scared because I did not know how our bodies will react to the insane altitude and climate of Leh. Lots of sleepless nights of planning later, we found ourselves flying to this destination of dreams. Let me take you through our journey.

The arrival in Kashmir does not require any in-flight announcement. The surreal visuals themselves welcome you to the land of mountains. ProTip: Always have an early morning flight while traveling to mountains. ¬†After landing on probably the world‚Äôs highest runway, and probably the only one which had pelted stones on either side of it, we went and checked in our beautiful hotel. The plan was to give at least 24 hours to our bodies to acclimatise to the altitude and climate so that no one falls ill.

We had planned long shoot days ahead. ¬†So while Vidit & Aparna rested, we being photographers do not know the definition of rest.

¬†Somehow I believe, the sunlight falls differently in mountains and it‚Äôs surreal.

And few hours of recce later, we came back and had some rest & prepared for next day‚Äôs early morning shoot at Shanti Stupa.

And that concluded our morning shoot. Everyone was hungry and the food is a luxury at Leh. Luckily we didn‚Äôt have to travel a lot to find food and the ‚ÄúChopsticks‚Äù catered amazing things nearby. Getting some rest afterward, we head to the famous Magnetic Hill.

Huge mountains, barren land, sun shining brightly

The wind was insane and that‚Äôs not necessarily a bad thing in photography¬†üòÄ

The sun was setting fast so we had to make use of every light ray possible!

We felt we the first humans to land on Mars! But even there, we‚Äôll make epic photos¬†üòâ That combined with the limited amount of oxygen levels was enough to make everyone tired. We went back to get some rest as next day was reserved for taming the world‚Äôs highest motorable road & the changla pass!

Good morning from the road to Khardungla Pass! Every single sight along the way was a picture in itself. How could we miss the chance to get some wallpapers?¬†üôÇ

¬†And we were there at Changla pass.

¬†It was an incredibly tough terrain and it was impossible to even stand there because of the bone-chilling winds and the scarcity of oxygen in the air. Imagine the Indian Army soldiers who guard the homeland in such terrains every single day.

¬†

And then we reached Khardungla! The highest motorable road in the world!

The climate & the chilling winds allowed us to take limited photos there. Before it can hit any of us, we wrapped up and came back for our next part of our journey. This one was also going to be my favorite part¬†üòÄ The next morning, we started our journey to the beautiful Pangong Tso lake. Everyone warned us that it‚Äôs too cold there and you‚Äôll proabably not find a place to stay, but we went on regardless. How can anyone go to Leh and not to Pangong Tso!

¬†And there we were. The serene blue waters of Pangong Tso. No photograph can do justice to what you feel when you first see it.

¬†We were to shoot here the next day. I could write a nobel prize winning research paper if I can pen down the calculations going on in my mind that time, in hopes of getting everything right next morning

¬†And finally we reached the shore. As told, there was no place to stay we could find nearby. But with a habit of not giving up, we kept on looking and finally found one lone place open in the middle of nowhere. Luckily they had the acommodation and few more people there who were crazy like us to visit Pangong at that time. We were at least sorted! ¬†Our drive was of around 5 hours and was very challenging on our bodies. Again, rest for that evening and night was required to make sure everyone was able to breathe and walk the next day.

But recce > rest üòÄ We had to make sure we exactly know everything, every location, the sunlight We had to make sure we exactly know everything, every location, the sunlight, the water currents, approximation of wind and zillion other things in our heads before we put Vidit & Aparna to shoot the next day. So we went on to take our notes!¬†

¬†And Pangong Tso welcomed us with open arms and blue waters!

¬† ¬† ¬† As the sun set, Pangong offered us various colors of itself! One more thing that places like Pangong Tso offer other than the surreal sights of water and mountains is, the sight of our own galaxy. There are very few places you can see the stars and galaxies so clear that you just want to touch them. With tempratures droppign to sub-zero at the night, we had this plan of creating something different with stars and galaxy as the backdrop. When we explained the idea to Vidit & Aparna, they jumped in. We secured our bodies to fight the climate and went on to do our experiments of the night sky at Pangong And we had a totally YES! moment with those photographs that night!¬†üôÇ

Next day was the most important one and we had great plans to execute at Pangong during the day. That day was our departure day from there as well so we had to make sure everything was on time as the sun and waters won‚Äôt wait for us!

¬† ¬† We wanted to show the surreal scale of nature while not losing the point of what we were there to shoot! While we were in the middle of the shoot, one thing that Aparna, and all of you didn‚Äôt know till now was that Vidit, I and Rituraj had a secret surprise for her which was in the picture since the starting. A convinced Aparna who thought Vidit, as always, would‚Äôve forgot¬†to carry the promise rings that they‚Äôve got for themselves was in for a big surprise! We asked both of them to stand back to back and used our secret code to signal Vidit that now was the time! The reaction on Aparna‚Äôs face made it all worth it!¬†üôÇ ¬† And then I made my favorite photograph!

And that was the epic story of Vidit & Aparna. We can conveniently call it the world‚Äôs highest pre-wedding shoot ever done. Or the world‚Äôs most crazy shoot. Or the world‚Äôs most challenging or tiring. Whatever you call it, it was a bone-breaking, heart-warming experience and we loved every bit of it. I hope you enjoyed the pictures¬†üòÄ
